original: Paścattāpaḥ bhavan dharmaratna mitracarya /
analyzed: paścattāpaḥ bhavan dharmaratna mitracarya
translated: Later, remorse arises. O Dharma-jewel, practice friendship.

original: lakṣmīr nirāmayo dīrgham āyuś ca bhavate bhavet /
analyzed: lakṣmīḥ nirāmayaḥ dīrgham āyuḥ ca bhavate bhavet
translated: Wealth, freedom from disease, and long life will be yours in this world.

original: ratnatrayānubhāvena śāsanasyābhivṛddhaye // //
analyzed: ratnatraya anubhāvena śāsanasya abhivṛddhaye
translated: By the power of the Three Jewels, for the prosperity of the teachings,

original: yāce bhavanta prastāva piśitāsthimaye mama /
analyzed: yāce bhavanta prastāva piśita asthi maye mama
translated: I request you, please, to make my body of flesh and bones

original: śarīre viśadīkartu daurbalya jarayā kṛtam // //
analyzed: śarīre jarayā kṛtam
translated: Clearer, having removed the weakness caused by old age.

original: bhoja bhoja piśita me pāyya pāyya ca śoṇitam /
analyzed: bhoja bhoja piśita me pāyya pāyya ca śoṇitam
translated: Eat, eat my flesh, drink, drink my blood,

original: neya neya kṛśatva mā śiśleṣa yakṣiṇī jarā // //
analyzed: mā śiśleṣa yakṣiṇī jarā
translated: Lead, lead me to emaciation, do not let the Yakshini old age prevail.

original: indriyāṇā bala nāsti mama kutra gatā smṛtiḥ /
analyzed: indriyāṇā bala na asti mama kutra gatā smṛtiḥ
translated: My senses have no strength, where has my memory gone?

original: vātāhatakadalīva vapuḥ samprati vepate // //🔽muhur muhur vepamāno namrapṛṣṭhaśirodharaḥ /🔽daṇḍapāṇir vārddhako 'ya praskhalan nityam ācaret // //
analyzed: vāta āhata kadalī iva vapuḥ samprati vepate  / muhur muhur vepamānaḥ namra pṛṣṭha śirodharaḥ  daṇḍa pāṇiḥ vārddhakaḥ praskhalan nityam ācaret
translated: My body now trembles like a plantain tree struck by the wind.🔽Shaking again and again, with a bent back and neck,🔽This old man, with a staff in hand, always stumbles and acts.

original: asahyapīḍana hastapādeṣu varīvṛtyate /
analyzed: asahya pīḍana hasta pādeṣu varīvṛtyate
translated: In his hands and feet, unable to bear the pain, he writhes.

original: vāriṇi budbudānīva syandante svedavipruṣaḥ // //🔽yathendukāntiḥ kṛṣṇe dṛṣṭiśaktir anukramam /
analyzed: vāriṇi budbudāni iva syandante sveda vipruṣaḥ  yathā indu kāntiḥ kṛṣṇe dṛṣṭi śaktiḥ anukramam
translated: Sweat drops fall like bubbles in water.🔽Just as the moon's radiance gradually diminishes in the dark fortnight,

original: kṣayaty upacakṣuṣāpi nāsti ki cit prayojanam // //
analyzed: kṣayati upacakṣuṣā api na asti ki cit prayojanam
translated: Even when it is seen, there is no purpose at all.

original: śāśvasyate yathā bhastrā niṣṭhīvati kṣaṇa kṣaṇam /
analyzed: śāśvasyate yathā bhastrā niṣṭhīvati kṣaṇa kṣaṇam
translated: Just as a bellows is constantly spat upon,

original: jalotkṣipto yathā mīnaḥ pāṇir bhūyaḥ pravepate // //
analyzed: jala utkṣiptaḥ yathā mīnaḥ pāṇiḥ bhūyas pravepate
translated: just as a fish thrown up on land trembles again and again,

original: aho yauvanalakṣmīr mā kadā cit punar eti na /
analyzed: aho yauvana lakṣmīḥ mā kadā cit punar eti na
translated: Alas! The glory of youth never returns again.

original: mukharaṅge 'dhunā vāṇī na nṛtyati yathepsitam // //
analyzed: mukha raṅge dhunā vāṇī na nṛtyati yathā īpsitam
translated: Now the voice does not dance on the stage of the face as desired.

original: gatā matiḥ cyutā śaktir āyur yāti dina prati /
analyzed: gatā matiḥ cyutā śaktiḥ āyuḥ yāti
translated: The mind has gone, the power has slipped away, life passes day by day.

original: mṛtyur āsya hi vyādāya sammukhe mama tiṣṭhati // //
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ āsya hi vyādāya sammukhe mama tiṣṭhati  /
translated: Death stands before me with its mouth wide open.

original: lekhanī lekhanāgāre viśrāntā phalakopari /🔽viprahīṇā kāvyacintā rekheva rekhitā jale // //
analyzed: lekhanī lekhanāgāre viśrāntā phalaka upari  viprahīṇā kāvya cintā rekhā iva rekhitā jale
translated: The pen, tired in the writing room, rests on the desk.🔽Deprived of poetic thought, it is drawn like a line in water.

original: aśrānta paṭhitā granthāḥ śerate pustakālaye /
analyzed: aśrānta paṭhitā granthāḥ śerate pustakālaye
translated: Books, read tirelessly, lie in the library.

original: parāmṛśanti tān adya kṛmayo mūṣikā api // //🔽sarve kṣayāntāḥ sasāre naivātmāpi bhavatraye /
analyzed: parāmṛśanti tān adya kṛmayaḥ mūṣikāḥ api  sarve kṣaya antāḥ sasāre na eva ātmā api bhava traye
translated: Worms and mice are now examining them.🔽All things end in destruction, even the self in the three worlds.

original: munipradiṣṭakaivalyam akṣaya hi kadā cana // //
analyzed: muni pradiṣṭa kaivalyam akṣaya hi kadā cana
translated: But the liberation taught by the sages is indeed imperishable.

original: paścāttāpo varīvartti smarato yauvanasya me /
analyzed: paścāttāpaḥ varīvarti smarataḥ yauvanasya me
translated: Remorse increases as I remember my youth.

original: śośucyate hanta yathā bhagnapucchajaradgavaḥ // //
analyzed: śośucyate hanta yathā bhagna puccha jaradgavaḥ
translated: Alas! It is as if a bull with a broken tail is burning with grief.

original: ā janmano 'śitisaptavarṣiko jarayā hataḥ /
analyzed: ā śiti sapta varṣikaḥ jarayā hataḥ
translated: From birth until seven years old, I was killed by old age.

original: itaḥ para katha kuryāt padyabandha rasātmakam // //
analyzed: itas kuryāt padyabandha rasa ātmakam
translated: What else could one do after this, in the form of a poetic composition with rasa?
